headline.print_headline: Britain: Blair’s Wife Says Messages Were Hacked, and She Files Suit
headline.main: Britain: Blair’s Wife Says Messages Were Hacked, and She Files Suit

docs.snippet: Cherie Blair, the wife of former Prime Minister Tony Blair, has begun legal action over what she says was the interception of her private phone messages, her lawyer said on Wednesday....

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Cherie Blair, wife of former Prime Minister Tony Blair, begins legal action over what she says was interception of her private phone messages; her legal firm has pursued phone hacking cases against Rupert Murdoch's British newspapers but refuses to say whom she is suing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cherie Blair, the wife of former Prime Minister Tony Blair, has begun legal action over what she says was the interception of her private phone messages, her lawyer said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: For 41 Years, Town Cheers Danny’s Boys
headline.seo: For 41 Years, Town Cheers Oregon Tech Coach Danny Miles
headline.main: For 41 Years, Town Cheers Danny’s Boys

docs.snippet: Danny Miles has coached basketball at Oregon Tech for 41 years, winning over 900 games and doing his part to keep Klamath Falls together along the way....
docs.abstract: Profile of Oregon Tech men's basketball coach Danny Miles, who has led the college program for 41 years, winning over 900 games and doing his part to keep Klamath Falls together along the way.
docs.lead_paragraph: Danny Miles has coached basketball at Oregon Tech for 41 years, winning over 900 games and doing his part to keep Klamath Falls together along the way.

headline.print_headline: Italy: Flaw Found in Neutrino Test
headline.main: Italy: Flaw Found in Neutrino Test

docs.snippet: The flaw in the technical setup of an experiment that appeared to show particles traveling faster than light, may have affected measurements that clocked subatomic neutrino particles....
docs.abstract: Researchers in Italy have found a flaw in the technical setup of an experiment that appeared to show particles traveling faster than light; say flaw may have affected measurements that clocked subatomic neutrino particles.
docs.lead_paragraph: The flaw in the technical setup of an experiment that appeared to show particles traveling faster than light, may have affected measurements that clocked subatomic neutrino particles.

headline.print_headline: Mutated Trout Raise New Concerns Near Mine Sites
headline.seo: Mutated Trout Raise New Concerns Over Selenium
headline.main: Mutated Trout Raise New Concerns Near Mine Sites

docs.snippet: Selenium, a metal byproduct of mining that is known to be toxic to wildlife, is under review by federal agencies who are re-evaluating safe levels in creeks in southern Idaho....
docs.abstract: Selenium, a metal byproduct of mining that is known to be toxic to wildlife, is under review by federal agencies that are re-evaluating safe levels in creeks in southern Idaho; study commissioned by J R Simplot, whose mining operations have polluted creeks there concluded that it would be safe to allow selenium mining, despite a photograph in the report of variously mutated brown trout.
docs.lead_paragraph: Selenium, a metal byproduct of mining that is known to be toxic to wildlife, is under review by federal agencies who are re-evaluating safe levels in creeks in southern Idaho.

headline.print_headline: Israel Approves Building Plan For 600 Homes in West Bank
headline.main: Israel Approves Building Plan for 600 Homes in West Bank

docs.snippet: The approval drew rebukes from the United Nations and Palestinians, while Israeli officials tried to play down the decisionsaying that construction was years away at best....
docs.abstract: Israel gives preliminary approval to plan to build 600 new homes in a settlement inside the West Bank, move that draws rebukes from the United Nations and Palestinians.
docs.lead_paragraph: The approval drew rebukes from the United Nations and Palestinians, while Israeli officials tried to play down the decisionsaying that construction was years away at best.

docs.snippet: The five-time FIFA player of the year Marta will return to the Swedish league with the club Tyreso after three seasons in Women’s Professional Soccer in the United States....

headline.print_headline: Changing Times for a Legend in Men’s Wear
headline.seo: Changing Times for Rothmans, a Famous Name in Men’s Wear
headline.main: Changing Times for a Legend in Men’s Wear

docs.snippet: Rothmans, one of the last family-run clothing businesses in Manhattan, is taking a big risk for a small business, opening in a new location as it tries to attract a younger, trendier customer....
docs.abstract: Brothers Jim and Ken Giddon, owners of Rothmans, one of the last family-run clothing businesses in Manhattan, are taking a double risk with the family business; men's wear retailer is moving, after decades in its original location, to a less visible address and will introduce more contemporary labels that will appeal to a younger, trendier customer base.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rothmans, one of the last family-run clothing businesses in Manhattan, is taking a big risk for a small business, opening in a new location as it tries to attract a younger, trendier customer.

headline.print_headline: World Leaders Are Meeting in a Script All Too Familiar to Somalis
headline.seo: World Leaders Meeting in London to Discuss Somalia
headline.main: World Leaders Are Meeting in a Script All Too Familiar to Somalis

docs.snippet: To address Somalia’s problems, world representatives are gathering in London, where a final communiqué has already been drafted....
docs.abstract: Representatives from about 40 countries are gathering in London in attempt to establish a functional government in Somalia; Somalis themselves are skeptical that any conference 4,000 miles away will solve anything, saying people on the ground need to be involved.

byline.contributor: Mohamed Ibrahim contributed reporting from Mogadishu, Somalia.

docs.lead_paragraph: To address Somalia’s problems, world representatives are gathering in London, where a final communiqué has already been drafted.
